vulnerabilities.name: Apache Log4j2 Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.description: Apache Log4j2 versions 2.0-beta9 through 2.14.1 are vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) where an attacker with permission to modify the logging configuration file can construct a malicious configuration using a JDBC Appender with a data source referencing a JNDI URI which can execute remote code.

vulnerabilities.name: OpenSSL TLS 1.3 Handshake DoS
vulnerabilities.description: A vulnerability in OpenSSL allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (DoS) by sending crafted TLS 1.3 handshake messages that trigger excessive memory allocation.

vulnerabilities.name: MySQL Authentication Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: MySQL Server versions 8.0.0 through 8.0.33 are vulnerable to authentication bypass where an attacker can connect to the database without proper credentials under certain conditions.

vulnerabilities.name: Nginx Information Disclosure
vulnerabilities.description: Nginx versions 1.20.0 through 1.24.0 are vulnerable to information disclosure where error pages may reveal sensitive information about the server configuration.

vulnerabilities.name: Redis Unauthorized Access
vulnerabilities.description: Redis instances configured without authentication are vulnerable to unauthorized access, allowing attackers to read, write, or delete data stored in the database.

vulnerabilities.name: Docker Container Escape
vulnerabilities.description: Docker versions prior to 20.10.0 are vulnerable to container escape where a malicious container can gain access to the host system through kernel vulnerabilities.

vulnerabilities.name: WordPress Plugin SQL Injection
vulnerabilities.description: A popular WordPress plugin contains a SQL injection vulnerability that allows attackers to execute arbitrary SQL queries and potentially gain administrative access.

vulnerabilities.name: SSH Weak Key Exchange
vulnerabilities.description: SSH servers configured with weak key exchange algorithms are vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks where attackers can intercept and decrypt communications.
